data.description: APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:CURRENT PENN STATE EMPLOYEE (faculty, staff, technical service, or student), please login to Workday to complete the internal application process. Please do not apply here, apply internally through Workday. CURRENT PENN STATE STUDENT (not employed previously at the university) and seeking employment with Penn State, please login to Workday to complete the student application process. Please do not apply here, apply internally through Workday.If you are NOT a current employee or student, please click “Apply” and complete the application process for external applicants. Approval of remote and hybrid work is not guaranteed regardless of work location. For additional information on remote work at Penn State, see Notice to Out of State Applicants.  JOB DESCRIPTION AND POSITION REQUIREMENTSThe College/Unit of IST is seeking applicants for part-time job of Graduate Assistant.Job duties to include:Guide and execute development of a general data collection system that other researchers can use (incorporating both user-facing and researcher-facing elements).Develop wireframes and mockups of the systemGuide software development with a team of engineersDesign an evaluation study for the system to test for comprehensiveness and usabilityWrite a research paper reporting on the process and evaluationPublish results (targeting spring 2026).Requirements, qualifications, and/or competenciesMust be a currently-enrolled graduate student in good standing (master’s or doctoral level).Coursework or experience in relevant fields (data ethics, HCI, app development, mobile software engineering, computational social science, etc) preferred.Strong interpersonal, problem-solving, and written/oral communication skills - This position will collaborate closely with research partners from other institutions, other students, and developers, so the ability to work and problem solve with others is critical.Technical skills:Must have experience with developing mobile applications on Android, working with Gradle, Java/XML, and Google Play Console.Preference for experience with Flutter and Flutter plugins.Must have experience with backend frameworks such as: Phoenix/Elixir (preferred), Ruby on Rails, Django, etc.Must have strong technical communication skills for documenting and communicating with other project contributors and stakeholders. BACKGROUND CHECKS/CLEARANCESEmployment with the University will require successful completion of background check(s) in accordance with University policies.   CAMPUS SECURITY CRIME STATISTICSPursuant to the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act and the Pennsylvania Act of 1988, Penn State publishes a combined Annual Security and Annual Fire Safety Report (ASR). The ASR includes crime statistics and institutional policies concerning campus security, such as those concerning alcohol and drug use, crime prevention, the reporting of crimes, sexual assault, and other matters. The ASR is available for review here. EEO IS THE LAWPenn State is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you are unable to use our online application process due to an impairment or disability, please contact 814-865-1473. The Pennsylvania State University is committed to and accountable for advancing equity, respect, and belonging. We embrace individual uniqueness, as well as a culture of belonging that supports equity initiatives, leverages the educational and institutional benefits of inclusion in society, and provides opportunities for engagement intended to help all members of the community thrive. We value belonging as a core strength and an essential element of the university’s teaching, research, and service mission. Federal Contractors Labor Law PosterPA State Labor Law PosterPenn State PoliciesCopyright InformationHotlines
requirements: Must have experience with developing mobile applications on Android, working with Gradle, Java/XML, and Google Play Console.
Must have experience with backend frameworks such as: Phoenix/Elixir (preferred), Ruby on Rails, Django, etc.
Must have strong technical communication skills for documenting and communicating with other project contributors and stakeholders.
responsibilities: Guide and execute development of a general data collection system that other researchers can use (incorporating both user-facing and researcher-facing elements).
Develop wireframes and mockups of the system
Guide software development with a team of engineers
Coursework or experience in relevant fields (data ethics, HCI, app development, mobile software engineering, computational social science, etc) preferred.

Strong interpersonal, problem-solving, and written/oral communication skills - This position will collaborate closely with research partners from other institutions, other students, and developers, so the ability to work and problem solve with others is critical.
